title: Muri x The Four Horseman
description:
Fermented sour cherry, lacto beets and ice clarified tomato
This is our collaboration with The Four Horsemen, the legendary Brooklyn restaurant co-owned by LCD Soundsystem’s James Murphy. A longtime supporter of MURI, the restaurant is known for its world-class wine list curated by the late Beverage Director, Justin Chearno.
We both wanted to create a bottle that was more 'wine-adjacent' than our typical blends as Justin wanted to match the excellent guest experience for those note drinking alcohol. The end result was balanced, complex, and deeply personal, made for pairing with the restaurant’s acclaimed food while offering non-drinkers the same sense of occasion.
We make a local Stevnsbær sour cherry wine, adding fermented ice-clarified tomato. We then blend lacto-fermented beetroot to deepen the savory complexity and a kefir infused with bay leaf and green peppercorn for herbal spice and structure.

title: Jean Francois Ganevat Vieux Macvin du Jura 2012
description:
Jean-François Ganevat’s 2012 Vieux Macvin du Jura is a fortified wine made by blending aged Marc with fresh Jura grape must, then aging the blend in oak barrels. This rare expression showcases the region’s tradition of aromatic and textured sweet wines.
It offers complex notes of dried fruit, nuts, honey, and spice, balanced by fresh acidity and a long, rich finish. A sophisticated, age-worthy Jura fortified wine with layered depth.

description: 50/50 Chardonnay, Pinot Noir Lutetian is represented by a deposit of calcareous sand, rich in fossilized shells, which bear witness to a tropical sea. 45 million years ago, this sea from the Paris Basin extended as far as Champagne. From vineyards in the village of Vandières, this 50/50 blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir has both power and precision with a talcum texture reminiscent of the finest limestone-rich terroirs.

title: Legrand Latour Ypresien Extra Brut 2020
description:
80/20 Pinot Meunier, Pinot Noir
Ypresian is a geologic period from 48-56 million years ago. The successive sedimentations that form this terroir are sometimes from fresh water and sometimes from sea water. From Meunier and Pinot Noir grown in soils of marl, clay, fine sand, and sandstone in the villages of Vandières and Verneuil, this blend has depth and drive with a crunchy mineral underpinning.

title: Legrand Latour Eocene Brut Nature 2020
description: 50/50 Chardonnay, Pinot Meunier Eocene includes all geologic periods that formed the land 34-56 million years ago. From vineyards grown in clay-loamy, sandy, and green-clay soils in the village of Verneuil, this 50/50 blend of Chardonnay and Meunier is fine-tuned and energetic with lovely weight and length.

description: Trousseau MAGNUM Trousseau from forty year old vines in the parcel ‘Les Corvées’ near Montigny-les-Arsures, the spiritual home of the grape where the Jurassic marl provides perfect growing conditions. For this bottling, Alice blended the wines from 2022 and 2023, the former providing depth and complexity, the latter lending freshness. In each case the fruit was destemmed and spent two months on skins in cuve, before being pressed off to cuve to rest until assemblage in the spring of 2024. Full of energy, this encapsulates everything we love about the grape.

description: Chardonnay This wine comes from purchased fruit sourced from two organic parcels, in total the equivalent of 1.10 hectares of land. The first parcel was planted in 1980 and is exposed West, the second in 2005 and exposed South.

title: De Moor Chablis Premier Cru Vau De Vey 2022
description: Chardonnay The De Moors purchased 0.92 hectares of this Premier Cru vineyard in 2017. The name is local dialect for "little valley". The soils feature a heavy marl  that remind Olivier of the Rosette vineyard. The hill here is much steeper though.

title: De Moor Chablis Coteau de Rosette 2022
description: Chardonnay Fermentation and aging can occur in different vessels each vintage depending on the global quantities. For this wine, a small foudre (1200l) and 228l barrels and are usually used along with enamel lined tanks in generous vintages. Long alcoholic and malolactic fermentation. Aged 11 months on the lees without racking or cold stabilization. The wine is normally bottled without filtration but may go through a light, non sterile one if deemed necessary.

title: De Moor Chablis Premier Cru Mont De Milieu 2022
description: Chardonnay The De Moor acquired 0.82 hectares of this 1er Cru in 2017. It is extremely steep and has to be worked by horse as it is too dangerous to work by tractor (hence why everyone else uses herbicide). The site gets its name (Mount of Middle) because it's on the border of Champagne. The vines at the bottom of the hill were planted in the 80's and the middle and the top in the 1930's. Yields in the old vines are very low and concentrated due to Court Noue.

title: De Moor L'Humeur Du Temps 2023
description: Chardonnay L' Humeur du Temps roughly translates to "The Mood of the Times" but is a double entrendre that also could mean "The Mood of the Weather". The idea with this cuvee is to capture a global snapshot of the vintage versus the nuance of a single vineyard bottling. In such, the wine comes from four parcels that are vinified separately then blended: Côte de l' Etang, Les Envers de Côte Chétif, Les Goulots de Jouan. Other fun fact: Olivier drew the label  himself!

title: De Moor Chablis Bel-Air et Clardy 2023
description: Chardonnay This wine comes from two parcels, Bel-Air and Clardy. Through years of experimentation the De Moor came to realize highly complement each other when blended. They are only 300 meters from each other but show very different expressions. Both planted in 1993, Bel-Air is planted is rocky Portlandian limestone while Clardy is planted in vines that almost immediately hit limestone.

title: Keller Riesling RR 2024
description:
Riesling
Keller’s “RR” is one of those insider’s bottles. Normally, the wine is sourced from a rare red-soil parcel within the Kirchspiel. This cask rarely ferments totally dry and the Kellers have always enjoyed the natural balance of the wine. It’s what we’d call a “feinherb” – the wine is just a bit off-dry. Normally, you’ll see the bottle labeled as “Kirchspiel RR,” the “RR” denoting “Riesling” from the “Red” soil.

title: Keller Riesling Limestone Kabinett 2024
description: Riesling This wine is all in the name—Limestone—perfumed and delicate and an absolutely a salty, piquant delight of a wine.

title: Philokalia Stubborn Saints 2023
description: Native red blend Philokalia is a small natural winery founded in 2015 by architect Sari Kouri in Bethlehem, Palestine. The winery produces approximately 5,000 bottles annually with no additives, using a mix of stainless steel and clay vessels. Philokalia works with old farmers to preserve the heritage of grape farming and uses Palestinian indigenous varietals in their wines.

title: Heya Wines Ward 2023
description: Tempranillo Heya is producing the first women-made wines from indigenous Lebanese grapes. These natural wines are produced sustainably and organically, and feature real women harvest workers on their label images. Heya is committed to driving pay equity for women harvest workers from Syria who are traditionally underpaid.

title: Heya Wines Farha 2023
description: Merwah, Red Delicious Coferment of Lebanese grapes and apples Heya is producing the first women-made wines from indigenous Lebanese grapes. These natural wines are produced sustainably and organically, and feature real women harvest workers on their label images. Heya is committed to driving pay equity for women harvest workers from Syria who are traditionally underpaid.

title: Dar Richi Helem 2022
description: Chardonnay Abdullah Richi is a Syrian refugee who fled the violence of the Syrian war and sought refuge in Lebanon. With a keen interest in winemaking, Abdullah learned the craft by observing winemaker Eddie Chami of Mersel Wines, and used his newly acquired skills to create an exquisite red wine, which he named after his wife, Hanan.

title: Weiser-Kuntsler Sonnenlay Riesling Kabinett 2024
description:
Riesling

Amidst the range of Kabinetts that Wei-Kü make in a year, the Sonnenlay is often the most elegant, reminding me a bit of the form of a classic middle Mosel Kabinett. It also happens to be one of Alexandra’s favorite vineyards.

In 2024, the rapier-like acidity and the 40g of RS leads to a Kabinett that tastes nearly dry at this point of its youth. As is often the case, there is a fresh, mountain stream quality here with light angles cutting across the palate as the wine comes in waves.

title: Vinos Norzagorai Garua 2023
description: Tempranillo Carbonic maceration Tempranillo . Quite a tradition here in Rioja Alavesa, I make CM in Beaujolais style in CO2 saturated closed stainless steel tank, not in the typical open cement vats of Rioja. It’s pressed at ‘dryness’ but since there are plenty of whole bunches at this point, fermentation does pick up and go on for a couple of days longer. Then I just leave it to undergo malolactic fermentation slowly in the winery’s basement at lowish temperatures to have some of that CO2 dissolved into the wine. Then it’s lightly filtered and bottled around April-June. I normally make this wine upon request for those interested in an easy drinking young wine out of the younger parcels I tend, those that are in conversion to organic and some bought grapes.

title: California Stars Love Me, Love Me Not 2024
Cantillon Vin Santo
description: Cantillon Vin Santo is a lambic made using the pomace of Trebbiano grapes coming from Tenuta di Capezzana macerated with 12 and 24-month-old lambic. The wine, also known as Vino Santo, is known for being a sweet dessert wine where it is traditionally served in Tuscany. The first batch was served during the Arrogant Sour Fest in Reggio Emilia, Italy in 2018. A second batch was also served at the same festival in 2019. The third and fourth batches saw a redesigned label by the artist AMMO, and were available for on-site consumption at the brewery as well as the restaurant Pasta Madre (now closed).

title: Cantillon Rose de Gambrius
description: Cantillon Rosé de Gambrinus is a traditional raspberry lambic (framboise) bottled regularly by Cantillon. Its fruit content is generally around 200 g of raspberries per 1 L of lambic. The fruiting process for Rosé de Gambrinus consists of taking pre-frozen raspberries and placing them in stainless steel tanks with an average age of 20-month-old lambic for a maceration period of 1-2 months. It is then transferred to a stainless steel bottling tank until it is ready to be bottled. A quantity of young lambic is added equal to one-third of the volume of the fruited lambic before bottling to obtain secondary fermentation.

title: Cantillon Magic Lambic
description: Cantillon Magic Lambic first debuted in the summer of 2018. It is a lambic blend of 80% Lou Pepe Framboise and 20% blueberry lambic with vanilla and was blended for the Magic Land Theater in Schaerbeek. It was bottled in 750 mL bottles as well as 3 L jeroboams and is listed as 5.5% ABV. Subsequent bottlings have been available at the brewery for on-site consumption only. The beer is periodically sold to go in limited quantities.

title: Cantillon Kriek
description: Cantillon Kriek 100% Lambic is a traditional kriek lambic bottled regularly by Cantillon. The fruit is a Morello (variety: Kelleris) sour cherry imported from Turkey with 200 g added per liter of lambic. The fruiting process for Kriek 100% Lambic consists of taking pre-frozen cherries and placing them whole in stainless steel tanks with two-year old lambic for a maceration period of 1-2 months. It is then transferred to a stainless steel bottling tank until it is ready to be bottled. A quantity of young lambic is added before bottling to obtain a secondary fermentation in the bottle.<sup id="cite_ref-CantillonBrochure_1-0" class="reference"></sup>

title: Cantillon Gueuze
description:
Cantillon Classice Gueuze 100% Lambic is a traditional gueuze bottled regularly by Cantillon. It is listed as 5% ABV.
A flagship beer, Cantillon Gueuze is the backbone of the Cantillon lineup and one of the most common bottlings to find. Over the years, its label has changed several times, and there are generally two to three labels for Classic Gueuze used at a time. The imported version to the U.S. from Shelton Brothers used the classic yellow label, while the European versions use the Manneken Pis labeling. In 2014, Cantillon introduced the newest label for their gueuze which has the Belgian flag as the back drop. In 2021, the label was redesigned again with a black & white background and a gold foil stamped logo.
It should be pointed out that there is no difference between the U.S version of "Classic Gueuze" and the 100% Bio/Organic bottlings. The labeling differences stem from different requirements by the United States versus the European Union in declaring a product organic. Cantillon currently does not meet U.S standards, but Cantillon notes on its website that it has used 100% organically grown grain for its lambics since 1999.

title: Cantillon Grenache Blanc
description: Cantillon Grenache Blanc is a grape lambic made from 300 g/L of Grenache Blanc grapes sourced at Domaine de Vantajou (who also provides the Syrah and Grenache Noir grapes for Saint Lamvinus), and grown under the Minervois AOC (Appellation d'Origine Controllée, or "controlled designation of origin") in the Languedoc-Roussillon region, south of France.

title: Cantillon Grandu Cru Bruocsella
description: Cantillon Bruocsella Grand Cru is a bottled old lambic released annually by Cantillon in various batches. It is one of the few examples of unadulterated lambic released in bottles by any commercial lambic producers. The lambic is matured for three years in oak barrels and bottled. Bruocsella Grand Cru is commonly available in 750 mL bottles as well as 375 mL bottles on occasion. It was also released in 1.5 L magnums in early 2016 at the brewery. The beer has no carbonation at bottling and will generally remain that way; however, older bottles are known to have exhibited lively carbonation. The brewery aptly compares this vieux lambic to a fine white wine in its appearance and taste. In fact, early labels for Bruocsella Grand Cru suggest serving it and storing it like a wine.

title: Cantillon Fou' Foune 2023
description: Cantillon Fou' Foune is an apricot lambic brewed yearly by Cantillon. According to Cantillon's website, an entire batch of Fou' Foune uses approximately 1200 kg of Bergeron apricots grown in France. Some labels reference 300 g/L of apricots. Jean Van Roy has also noted that the apricots used are grown organically. The fruits are cut in half, the pits removed from about half of the fruit, and the fruit is placed into a stainless steel tank with lambic for a maceration period. It is then transferred to a stainless steel bottling tank until it is ready to be bottled. Though the brewery states that Fou' Foune is only available in 750 mL bottles, it was also available in 375 mL bottles on at least two occasions: once in Japan (2010) and once in Belgium (2009). It has also been available in 20 L kegs at various festivals, including many Zwanze Day locations, and on tap at bars.

title: Cantillon Ashanti 2023
description: A new version of Zwanze 2022 ("Poivre des Gorilles" or "Gorilla pepper") with sligthly less pepper to allow for more balance. About 50 kg of black Gorilla pepper is added to 10 000 Liters of lambic, resulting in a ratio of about 5g / Liter.

title: Anders Frederik Steen Aging a wildflower on the last page of my favorite book 2013
description: 100% Pinot Gris The last two barrels of wines from 2013 have made it into bottles. It goes without saying that this wine is filled with emotions. For us these barrels have followed us since the first wines we made and therefore the entire evolution of our little Domaine, but also, for us they’re the very essence of the style of winemaking we have been aiming for since we started.Patience, ripe grapes, respect for the time needed in barrels, the balance that are created over time and the delicateness of oxidation. 100 % Pinot Gris, filled into barrels in the spring of 2014 where it stayed untouched for more than 10 years without any topping up, soutirage or any other things. The rich old fruit, the saltiness and the oxidation dominate this wine. Bottling an old wine like this, is in some way to capture a picture of the 10 years that have pasted. But it’s not a goodbye to these 10 years, it’s a hello to the years to come. It’s from today and onward it becomes interesting to follow this wine and all the small, slow movements it will make it the bottles – Patience is everything in winemaking, and in winedrinking!

title: Anders Frederik Steen Palpite un peu comme un coeur sauvage 2017
description:
Pinot Noir & Gewürztraminer

A field blend of Pinot Noir and Gewürztraminer. As we do with most grapes and freshly pressed juice in Alsace, the grapes were pressed overnight, and the juice left for oxidation and start fermentation in open casks. Followed by 6 months of fermentation in fiberglass cuves outside, soutirage in the spring of 2018 and élevage for 5 years in old barrels, without any topping up. 

 After bottling we decided to save the wine another 18 months in the cellar, before release. We did this to allow the acidity, the deep salty notes and the oxidation to find each other again. Some old wines need time to recreate the balance after bottling. Now it’s exactly the balance of all these elements that defines this wine – we’re therefore very happy for our decision and patience, something the wine have benefited a lot from.

title: Anders Frederik Steen It's the smell of the pine trees by the sea that I prefer 2019
description: Pinot Noir, Pinot Gris & Gewürztraminer  This wine is a rare example of an assemblage from our cellar. It was made a long time after the grapes where harvested and pressed. By the time of bottling, we decided to assemble a few single wine barrels, all 2019, but all deferent blends. This left us with a more balance and yet complex expression of the different barrels. And some more volume than the single barrels could offer us. We made this assemblage in May 2024 and believe that the wine now after six months, in bottles, are ready to be drunk. As all our barrels, they haven’t been topped up and the wine have therefor developed oxidative notes.

title: Anders Frederik Steen Tout ce qui est beau revient 2020
description:
100% Gewürztraminer 

 A wine made of rich and very aromatic Gewürztraminer at harvest time with a beautiful noble rot. We made a direct press of the grapes same day as we harvested them to be able to extract as much of these flavors as possible.

After a few days of oxidation, the juice went into fiberglass cuves to ferment over winter. After a soutirage in the spring of 2021, time just enough to add these yeasty and autolytic flavors that we love so much, the wine went into the cellar where it finished its fermentation and stayed another 3 ½ years in old barrels without topping up.

Gewürztraminer is in general moving slow when it comes to the development of flavors, and it took close to two years of élevage, before the oxidation started to make its mark. But as it always goes with aromatic varieties like Gewürztraminer, once the oxidation arrives, the oxidation takes its place and create together with the other aromas a beautiful balance.

description:
Grenache
a tiny parcel of ancient Grenache, worked entirely by hand, and with insanely low yields.

title: Unified Ferments Lapsang Souchong
description:
Lapsang Souchoung is a mature, broad leaf tea processed by being finished over a pinewood fire. The result is a silky, luxurious, unapologetically smokey profile.

Our ferment expresses lapsang’s characteristic velvety profile with nuanced tones of connifer, peat, sorghum, and a round lactic finish.
INGREDIENTS: SPARKLING WATER, SUGAR, KOMBUCHA STARTER, LAPSANG SOUCHOUNG TEA

title: Unified Ferments Wen Shan Bao Zhong
description:
Wen Shan Bao Zhong is a lightly oxidized, bright oolong produced in northern Taiwan. Our producer, a fourth generation tea-producing family from the Nantou region, uses their considerable experience to emphasize the powdery floral notes, deep oat sweetness, and subtle salinity that are the tea’s trademarks.

Our ferment concentrates this unique medley and produces notes of orchid, honeysuckle and fresh marzipan, resulting in a approachable, if unclassifiable, delight. INGREDIENTS: SPARKLING WATER, SUGAR, KOMBUCHA STARTER, WEN SHAN BAO ZHONG TEA

title: Unified Ferments Jasmine Green
description:
INGREDIENTS: FILTERED WATER, SUGAR, KOMBUCHA STARTER, JASMINE GREEN TEA PEARLS
Our Jasmine Green tea has been scented in the traditional style with eight different lots of fresh, whole jasmine buds before. This resulting jasmine-laden tea allows us to not only ferment the tea but also the flowers that flavor it.


Our ferment produces an enveloping medley of eucalyptus, tuberose, and green peach which undertones the elegant expression of jasmine flowers.

title: Domaine du Gringet Vers Etraz 2022
description: Gringet Etraz is crafted from Gringet grapes grown in a plot known as Vers Etraz, where the soil is rich in limestone scree. This very plot once produced Dominique Belluard’s famous Mont Blanc sparkling wine. After a delicate 7-hour pressing, the juice ferments naturally with native yeasts. The wine then spends 9 months on fine lees in egg-shaped concrete vats, followed by 10 months resting peacefully in the bottle, ready to be enjoyed!

title: von der Vogelwaide Kane Grade Red 2024
von der Vogelwaide Kane Grade White 2024
Matassa El Carner Rouge 2024
description: Grenache Gris Field Blend El Carner is a lieu-dit that produces two wines. There is a Grenache Gris field blend for the red and a neighboring parcel of Macabeu for the white. El Carner is local Catalan dialect for "The Ram". Two week, whole-cluster maceration. The wine is pressed and racked into clay anfora for fermentation and aging.

title: Matassa Blanc 2024
description: Grenache Gris and Macabeo This is Tom's top white wine and, interestingly, is the only white not produced and named after a single vineyard. Whole-cluster, direct press for the Grenache Gris. The Macabeu is macerated for two weeks. The wine is then pressed, racked and blended into a 2100L foudre for fermentation and aging. The wine ages on the lees until bottling.

title: Matassa Tattouine Rouge 2024
description: Grenache Gris and Carignan  No, it's not named after the planet from Star Wars. The wine comes from a single vineyard of red schist soils and is named after it. Whole-cluster, four week maceration. Pressed and racked into 2500L foudre for aging.

title: Matassa Cuvee Romanisa 2024
description: Grenache The wine comes from a single vineyard (Romanissa) composed of red schist soils and is named after it. Whole-cluster, four day maceration in fiberglass. The wine is then pressed and racked to ferment and and age in demi-muid.

title: Matassa Cuvee Alexandria 2024

Muscat d'Alexandria

title: Revel Cider Soif
description:
To make Soif, we blended two spontaneously fermented ciders aged on cherries and strawberries and added almost one tonne of red wine skins (Maréchal Foch) for an extra month of skin contact. It's a red fruit bonanza. Maréchal Foch and Montmorency Cherries meld into plush textural bliss. Strawberry aromas waft over it all. The fruit acids here are bright and lively.

Soif drinks like what wineries say their rosé tastes like—actual strawberries and cherries. It’s not shy, and really hits you over the head with fruit. The best part? It's dry and tart, with zero residual sugar (like all our ciders). Soif is easy. A thirst quencher; a glugger; a quaffable refresher.

title: Ruth Lewandowski Chilion 2022
description: Cortese The most contemplative orange wine we make, this is ever the intense apricot, oregano and baking spice number but the ‘22 is giving this beautiful Big Sur after rain vibe. Fresh eucalypt and faint pine forest … très California coast. 6 months of skin contact.

title: Ruth Lewandowski Tatto 2024
description: Friulano, Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling, Gruner Veltliner, Malvasia Bianca, Kerner, Trebbiano, Moscato Bianco Each was vinified separately by way of whole cluster skin maceration during fermentation. The bombastic and imminently drinkable skin contact one.

title: Stefan Vetter Rotling 2022
description: Muller-Thurgau , Pinot Noir This is a roughly 50/50 blend of Pinot Noir and Müller-Thurgau, crushed and pressed together with élevage in large casks. If there is a more mineral, quinine, electrolyte-powdered wine we have not yet tasted it...It's a beguiling colour - between watermelon and orange Hi-C, with crystal clear berry flavors, a crunchy-salty minerality and just amazing verve. Pure refreshment. This will be bottled in a clear bottle with a crown cap.

title: Niccolo Coturri The Last Fisherman 2023
description: Red wine of your dreams. Light and refreshing. Cool climate, regeneratively grown grapes. A blend of old vine vinifera, young hybrid plantings, and local table grapes. A wine of the future, a wine to face climate change, but most importantly the wine people have been asking us for: a delicious Table Red, silky and tangy, food friendly and an all season delight. Drink now in the last gasp of summer. Drink in fall with the first wild mushrooms. Drink in winter with your sweetheart in front of the fire.

title: Niccolo Coturri Moon Bloom 2023
description:
Madeleine Angevine
A salty, tangy, crisp white made from the grape Madeleine Angevine, a grape that grows exceptionally well here in the Puget Sound. With gentle coaxing, Madeleine can transform into a layered, mineral-driven beverage that brings us back to the first Muscadet bottlings we drank in the early 2010s from winemakers like Marc Olivier and Luneau-Papin. In addition to being delicious, we have such a strong connection to this wine, as the third and penultimate release of the 2023 vintage from the vineyard we farm on Lopez Island. A vineyard we are now near completing our fourth season of farming in, having spent the seasons from cold January pruning days to late summer nights in the vineyard with our kids, tending the growth of this lovely place. Enjoy ice cold with seafood, or room temperature straight from your backpack after a long summer’s hike through the hills. An extremely versatile, people pleasing wine.   Label art by our friend Glenn Hendrick.

title: Niccolo Coturri Sun Beach Road 2023
description:
Siegerrebe
This wine, made from an aromatic white grape called Siegerrebe, fermented on its skins as classically done with red wines (categorically known as an Orange wine) is an exciting culmination of winemaking experience being applied to a new place and new grape.
A two week maceration on the grape skins has pulled and retained a perfect rosebud blush color. Aromatics are heady and balanced with light tannin. Like a laden patch of berries after a hot afternoon of sun drenched hours. Refreshing like sea breeze. A wine we are extremely proud of and love to drink. Think Quince paste, magnolia petal.
Label art by our dear friend local artist Glenn Hendrick.

title: Glassmaker Sangiovese 2022
description:
Sangiovese
fun around the corner. cherries dancing. vines grown on crumbled granite in a cool, hidden valley on the fault. get some salty salt meats. dusty, complex joy! -Jonathan Walton

title: Michel Guignier La R'vole 2023
description: Gamay This is the criterion of what it means to be a zero-zero (nothing added at all, not even SO2) wine. Utterly drinkable, precise, full of life. From the master of Gamay himself, Michel Guignier is working his Vaux-Renard vineyard with just his trusty horse. On the edge of a forest, this vineyard is teeming with life and bio-diversity. La R'Vole is deeper and darker with juicy ripe blackberry, forest floor and delicate tannins. No need to rely on the luck of the draw, this is always a good choice.

title: Michel Guignier La Bonne Pioche 2020
description:
Gamay
The vines for La Bonne Pioche are from a parcel within Michel’s farm, quite close to his house. When it was appellated it was classified as Beaujolais Villages, an appellation that covers vines grown in 38 communes, including Vauxrenard, where Michel’s farm is located.
This wine had 10 days of semi-carbonic maceration in stainless steel then spent 10 months in a foudre before bottling in July 2021. As with all the wines, its acidity ensures freshness and the viticulture and vinification provide the life.

Weiser-Kunstler Ellergrub Riesling Auslese GK 2023 375ml
description: Riesling The 2023er Enkircher Ellergrub Riesling Spätlese was made from botrytized fruit harvested at approx. 140° Oechsle on largely un-grafted vines still trained on single pole and was fermented down to noble-sweet levels of residual sugar (157 g/l). It offers an intensely smoky and rich nose of tar, candied grapefruit, mango, minty herbs, acacia honey, pine, almond cream, bakery paste, a touch of raisin, and white all wrapped into a hint of volatile which enhances the aromatics. The wine is quite intense on the palate, where fresh exotic fruits are wrapped in intense citrusy fruits, giving the whole an almost racy and taut feel. The finish is racy, vibrant, and superbly long.

title: Weiser-Kunstler Riesling Feinherb 2024
description: Riesling The Riesling Weiser-Künstler, as it is referred to on the main label (the reference to the vintage is left for the back label), is a barely off-dry wine (with 11 g/l of residual sugar) made from Estate holdings mainly in the Trabener Taubenhaus und Schlossberg. It offers a nice and direct nose of herbs, greengage, white peach, almond, and rosemary. The wine is straight and focused on the palate and leaves a slightly tart yet animating feel of herbs and citrusy fruits in the nice finish. This dry-tasting Riesling is good and refreshing.

title: Domaine de L'Ecu Taurus 2022
description:
Melon de Bourgogne
Light straw reflections. Elegant aromas with notes of citrus, dried fruits, white flowers, almond and toast, minerality. Full opulent palate balanced with fine acidity and liveliness showing the wine’s exquisite balance. Full bodied, complex and powerful, this special cuvee partially aged in oak will reveal to you another aspect of our terroirs. A wine gifted with great aging potential, a racy and exciting Melon B. for wine lovers.
 « We have brought particular care to this rare cuvee of Melon de Bourgogne. Do it the honor of serving with lobster or creamed white meats. Carafe before enjoying and discover the enjoyment for your palate… » Fred.
  Aged 2 years “on the lees”: 50% in Stockingers (Austrian oak barrels) and 50% in amphoras.

title: Andreas Tscheppe Butterfly Plus 2022
description: Gelber Muskateller During the harvest of 2021, a tempest with heavy rain and a significant temperature drop came when the wines were fermenting in Andreas’s new cellar which wasn’t completely finished back then. As a result, the fermentation stopped its usual pace and became very slow instead. As a solution, Andreas bottled the wine with the remaining residual sugar under crown caps, to let them finish the fermentation in the bottle and develop a bit of fizz. To distinguish this “cellar calamity edition” from the “regular” Butterfly cuvée made in other vintages, the word “plus” is stated on the back label.

title: Ormiale Borto 2019
description: 50% Merlot, 50% Cabernet Franc  “Global warming is no joke, and the vines impressively bear witness to this change. Borto – does the name right a bell? – is an aperitif and/or dessert wine. Bottled by gravity with a nozzle filler. Tremendously gastronomical and ready to provide bewildering food and wine pairings, Borto is crisp despite its alcohol, complex, spicy, disconcerting. Because of its incredible “stability”, it does not fear three weeks of opening if kept as it should. When the juice “decides”, wine always reminds us that it is generous and alive. And unique.”

Fantastic cherry nose, a palate of ripe black cherries picked at perfection.

description: Inziola One of the main characteristics of Inzolia is its low acidity, which is accompanied by a relatively low sugar level. And the grapes grown near the sea give such pleasant wines precisely because their very evident salinity is able to compensate for the sweetness of the must and to give the drink a pleasant sensation of freshness, enhanced by an intense bouquet of broom, chamomile flowers and with balsamic notes of thyme. - Cantine Barbera

description: Scheurebe and several clones of Muscat Maischevergoren translates to “skin contact.” The Muscat varietals Christian uses boast unique and concentrated favor in their skins; he presses them ever so gently, “with the power of a handshake.”

title: Christian Tschida Himmel Auf Erden Rosé 2022
description: Cabernet Franc Christian picks the grapes over 5 different harvest days in order to show off “the whole aromatic spectrum” of his highest, coolest vineyards.

title: Christian Tschida Birdscape 2023
description:
Blaufrankisch, Pinot Noir, and some white varieties
Birdscape is made with what Christian calls “Pink Maceration,” a very light extraction with just a small amount of contact with the skins, to result in a very dark rosé, or perhaps a very light red wine. Label art by Erró. ..a light red in our book

title: Sylvain Pataille Bourgogne Aligote Champ Forey 2021
description: Aligote Champ means field. The land must have belonged to a family named Forey. Only 75 cases of this cuvée are produced each year.

title: Vigna San Lorenzo Col Tamarie Prosecco 2022
description: Glera, Boschera, Perera, Bianchetta, Grapariol, Verdiso, Marzemina The wine spends a small amount of time on skins (apart from the 2017 vintage when the press was damaged and so accidentally had a longer skin maceration), never has any sulphites added and rests for a minimum of 10 months before being available.  This may originate from Prosecco territory, but it is so much more than that, the perfect addition to our growing sparkling selection.

title: Unico Zelo Esoterico 2022
description:
Zibibbo, Gewurtztraminer, Moscato Giallo, Greco, Chardonnay
This is one of the most enjoyable wines to craft, as there was no preconceived idea of what it must taste like - the chief driver is pure drinkability - a 'scrumptious' quality - mouthwatering acidity and 'say hello!' tannins. It's a Bohemian at heart. - Unico Zelo

title: Martin Texier Petite Nature 2022
description: Muscat, Chasselas Rose, and a mélange of different table varieties. Aromatic, dry, and energetic Pet Nat!

title: Domaine Dupasquier Gamay Savoie 2020
description: Gamay Gamay and Pinot Noir from Dupasquier have a gorgeous core of vivid, sweet red fruit and a textural harmony that speaks to their years of aging in barrel and bottle before release. - Selection Massale

title: J.L. Chave Selection Hermitage Rouge Farconnet 2020
description: Syrah The grapes come from 3 distinctive parts of the Hermitage hill. The majority of the blend comes from Diognières, which is at the base of the hill on alluvial soil with many small pebbles. It lends a note of spice to the wine. The next parcel is Péleat. It sits above Diognières and is composed of more sand and limestone in the clay. It gives finesse to the wine. And finally, Greffieux sits at the base of Le Méal on the hill. Its soil consists of rolled river stones brought by the glaciers. It brings structure to the finished wine. Farconnet was the name of a nobleman back in the time of Jean- Louis Chave’s great grandfather. He was actually the man from whom the great grandfather bought the Bessards parcel. -Shiverick Imports

title: Forlorn Hope Nacre Semillon 2014
description: Semillon The Nacré is produced in the same fashion as the Sémillons of Australia’s Hunter Valley and is capable of decades of aging. The wine bears the name Nacré -- meaning mother-of-pearl -- as a testament to its affinity for pairing with oysters. Crisp, racy and focused, with layer upon layer of flavor that opens up with decantation.

title: Slavcek Crno Red 2021
description: Cabernet sauvignon, Merlot, Refošk "A ruby red color with notes of spice, dark and red fruits, and earthy forest floor. Medium-bodied with fine tannins." -cheese and wine traders

title: ICARO Nemico
description: Trebbiano, Malvasia The name  Nemico  is a tribute to the  Volcanic Lake of Nemi which our small cellar overlooks. It is our first wine, the one we are most fond of and which best represents us and our territory..A  territorial white , fresh and irreverent, a wine in which minerality and aroma are in perfect balance with each other for a long, changeable and deep drink. He's the Enemy but he's good...trust me. He is the enemy only of bad people!

title: ICARO Operaio 2022
description:
Nero Buono, Trebiano, Malvasia 60% Red Grapes from Guyot-trained vineyards on volcanic soil, exposed to the Circeo sea and 40% White Grapes, from Tent-trained vineyards.
The white and red grapes ferment together in fiberglass after a 3-day maceration. The result is a wine of great freshness, surprising acidity and a crunchy tannin that lengthens and completes drinking.

title: ICARO Schicchera 2022
description: Trebbiano, Malvasia, Nero Buono Schicchera is a compulsively drunk rosé. It is for partying and revelry, for noisy dinners, crowded clubs, the beach and summer nights. We use white grapes and red grapes together, in whole bunch carbonic maceration in steel to load the aromatic bomb and explode the fruitiest and most intense characters of the grapes.

title: I Clivi Ribolla Gialla 2022
description: Ribolla Gialla  Aromatically subtle, with nose of lemon zest, palate marked by a refreshing citric acidity combined with a salty, very dry mineral finish.

title: North American Press Wildcard

The obtained elegance, purity and density makes this wine very suited to accompany a wide variety of dishes and cuisine -Frank

title: Liska Gruner Veltliner 2022
description: Gruner Veltliner Our way-too-limited Gruner Veltliner returns with the 2022 vintage. Simultaneously crisp and full on the palate, this wine is lively and age-worthy. Native fermentation, 10 months on its lees in barrel. 12.4% Alc.

title: Domaine de L'Enclos Chablis 'a l'ouest' Sans Soufre 2022

Pinot Noir

title: Mosse Magic of Juju 2024

title: Domaine De Panisse Cote Du Rhone Le Mazet 2020

The resulting wine is one that is bright and generous on the palate, easy to drink and delicious. A beautiful Côtes du Rhône that punches well above its weight. -caves

title: Partida Creus XL 2021

title: Jean-Pierre Robinot Lumiere des Sens 2023

title: Jean-Pierre Robinot Le Regard du Loire 2023

description: The following formula as base: 1 red barrel, 1 young red and 1 oxidized white. Varieties often change, Massimo elaborates by tasting what he has in the current aging to maintain a regular style.

title: Metal House Cider Sundown Wild Ferment 2019
description:
Apples! Sundown is a tribute to our many pilgrimages to the Catskills, where we handpick wild and untreated fruit growing under the stern and watchful eyes of the Kalonymus Escarpment, in a beautiful valley inhabited by generous friends…
Sundown is a field blend which fermented slowly with naturally occurring yeasts. -Metal House

title: COS Cerasuolo Di Vittoria Classico 2020
description: 60% Nero d'Avola, 40% Frappato The 2020 Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico has a wild side with punchy aromas of cherry, cola, crushed stone and mountain herb. These elements come together seamlessly, giving this wine a good sense of vertical lift and energy. - Polaner

title: Fossil & Fawn Willamette Valley Pinot Gris 2021
description: Pinot Gris We treat it no differently than our Pinot noir in the cellar, getting a full nine months of aging in mostly-neutral barrel. The result is striking: red currant, sandalwood, and a hint of orange peel. -Fossil & Fawn Is it orange? Is it pink?

Pinot Blanc
 ..in a nod to the grape’s Burgundian roots, they ferment and raise their Pinot Blanc in old barrels sourced from friends in the Côte d’Or. The result is, well, rare and exciting, to say the least. Floral and peach aromas give way to a rich, mouthwatering structure. Best to drink it now, given its vibrancy. -Chris Santini via KL

title: Christophe Mignon ADN de Foudre Meunier Brut Nature
description: Pinot Meunier A beautful shimmering hue, with elegant highlights, delicate and persistent ring of bubbles. Very clean and delicate nose, with subtle woody notes. Unctuous and round mouth, with toasted almond flavors. -Polaner

title: Vignes du Maynes Cuvee 910 Macon Rouge 2023
description: Chardonnay, Gamay, Pinot Noir The Cuvee 910 is back! This special cuvée is a commemoration of eleven hundred years of winemaking, the vineyards in the Clos des Vignes du Maynes having been planted around AD 900 and wine first produced for the Abbey of Cluny around 910.

title: Geierslay Vertigo Riesling Feinherb 2022
description:
Riesling
A breakout star in the Mosel coming from a historic winemaking family. Named for the vineyard's steep slope..off dry, citrus, mineral!

title: Camp Cabernet Sauvignon 2023
description: 92% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Merlot Camp Wines were created by the Hobo Wine Co. in 2011 to showcase the quality and value of Sonoma County wine. We work with top growers and vineyard managers in very high quality and responsibly farmed, though lesser known, vineyards throughout Sonoma County to produce delicious, approachable, and affordable wines. -Camp

title: Nicolas Joly Savennieres Les Vieux Clos 2021
description: Chenin Blanc One of the 3 Savennières that comes from the estate, Les Vieux Clos comes from younger vines (20 years old) and from vines planted in schist, quartz and sand. As with all the Savennières, the harvest is laborious as they take the time to harvest ideal grapes 4 or 5 times every fall. You'll find a golden hue, an oxidative style that is truly marvelous.

title: Kelley Fox Dux Vineyard Chardonnay 2021
description:
Chardonnay
Drinks beautifully now, but has the potentially to age for many years

title: Cingilia Pecorino 2020
description: Pecorino It presents bright and dry, a touch briney with notes of lemon, acacia, jasmine, and hints of straw, with a gorgeous mouthfeel and long finish. -Bibber and Bell

title: Unico Zelo Sea Foam 2022
description: Fiano, Vermentino We took the bowl of nashi pears & green apples that were the core of the wine and added a touch more white nectarine, frangipani and a whiff of grassy freshness. - Unico Zelo

title: Cosimo Maria Masini daphné 2021
description: 80% Trebbiano Toscano 20% Malvasia Bianca A golden color, Daphné is a complex wine with a strong structure similar to that of a red wine. Floral on the nose thanks to Malvasia Bianca,  it also has an expressive minerality with herbal notes thanks to the Trebbiano. It finishes with pleasant fruit and a long persistence.

title: Cappelletti Mazzura Aperitivo 200ml
description: It’s like a mashup of Aperol and Campari: most of the sweetness of the former and half the bitterness of the latter

title: Travis Tausend Sitting in a Tree 2021
description:
Merlot

The 2021 Sitting in a tree merlot is richer than i have ever made it before. A long and cool ripening period allowed the fruit to hang out on the vine for a while longer without the acid dropping away. After the fruit was hand picked I de-stemmed the fruit into large fermenters and covered the berries with direct pressed juice to start a semi carbonic ferment.

This is a wonderful full favoured Merlot with a balanced acidity that keeps it medium bodied and fresh. -Travis Tausend

title: Gemini LEDA 2019
description:
Cabernet Sauvignon, Sauvignon Blanc Simon Amber makes these wines...
He's a mate of Travis Tausend's - they actually share some winery space. Simon has been described to me as "the maddest chiller" lol. This is the classic Si Vintners blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sauvignon Blanc. 50/50 as he had a barrel of each. Savoury and lean and fresh... - Drnks

title: Maysara Arsheen Pinot Gris 2022
description: Pinot Gris Arsheen was an Archeamenian Princess during the 500 B.C. Era. She taught astronomy and was granted the role of winemaker in the palace due to her impeccable palate and knowledge.  Generously fragrant aromas leap out of the glass, offering jasmine, spiced pear, green apple, honeydew, and white peach. The palate is crisp, with the green apple carrying over, mandarin, and a steely yet balanced acidity ready to accompany complex dishes to backyard conversations.

Gruner Vetliner
The monarch of the Gut Oggau family dynasty
